name: Globus Hotel

reviews.title: Not as good as we expected
reviews.text: I was expecting this hotel to be very modern and have great rooms. Unfortunately our room didn't look like the photo on the website, and the standard double was so tiny we could barely move around. It also said in the distription that they had modern bathrooms, but ours was tiny and old. The shower was very awkward to use, and there was no ventilation. Whilst the reception looks modern like the photos on their website, everything else was a bit drab. It is a fairly central location, and is particularly good if you are coming by train, as it is only a 5 minute walk to the station.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Once again the Globus was great. We just stayed there (October 27-29), and loved it again. The staff are always helpful and friendly. Great location, Medici Chapel, Duomo and San Lorenzo Markets are within a 5 minute walk.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great food at the restaurant across and to the left of the hotel (loved the spinach ravioli). Reno and everyone at the wine bar across from the hotel offered great tidbits on food selections in Florence.
reviews.title: Good experience and nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At night we had no noise from the Disco around the corner and found the Dublin Pub to be a lot of fun with a mix of locals and tourists.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006
reviews.text: Many thanks to Nick, Alessandro and the rest of the Globus staff for making our stay very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Very small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you are trying to save money, it is fine to stay here but you do get what you pay for. I don't believe that this hotel should qualify as a 3 star hotel any longer. I stayed here 3 years ago, and it did then. However, in the past 3 years it seems to have become worn and a bit run down. The young man at the front desk is very nice which helped. My husband, daughter & myself were staying there (triple room) for 2 nights. First a man (apprx mid to late 20s) tried to rob my husband as my husband walked behind me on the rather narrow street near the hotel minutes prior to checking in. (It is close to the train station.) Fortunately, my husband put him into a fast headlock and pinned him to a car until storeowners came outside. Then (even though reservations were made months in advance) we were assigned to a room on the first floor that smelled badly. (I had told them in advance that I had asthma, and the hotel staff didn't even seem to notice the strong odor in the room.) After begging & pleading, I was told that we could take the quad room next door but would have to move back into the original room for the 2nd night since he said they were booked solid and a quad was coming. The quad room was fine (for the money). It didn't smell but spreads were worn (even a small tear in one) and the shower curtain (thin plastic) was moldy at the bottom. The next morning after begging, pleading etc they said to pack up all of our things and move them out of the quad room before touring and they'd see what they could do about a different room if we came back at noon. They did give us a room on an upper floor. It also smelled however and had worn spreads. There was a bit of mold on the shower curtain but not as bad as the quad room mold. Due to asthma, I also need my head elevated at night and require 2 pillows. The hotel said that they can only provide one pillow per person when they are booked solid because they do not have an extra pillow! My husband had to sleep without a pillow! This hotel was always very basic,utilitarian looking but it didn't appear worn down and faded 3 years ago. I was disappointed and wouldn't choose to stay here again. However, if I were on a strict budget and smells etc didn't bother me, I would consider staying here for the price. The breakfast is fine, the man who makes it is nice and they have free internet. It's a shame though that the hotel doesn't charge $5 extra and allot about $10 per night into a fund and segregate the money and use it to keep their rooms nice by replacing spreads and shower curtains on a regular basis and doing maintenance to prevent odors and problems. Despite someone attempting to rob us, I didn't really feel unsafe even though the hotel is in a rather narrow street.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I accidently discovered this hotel online and boy am I happy I did. At first from the website (and the prices!!!) I thought it was too good to be true. Well, it lived up to all our expectations. First of all, the hotel was in a great area, so close to everything. Also, the room was modern and clean and the staff were incredible! They were always so polite and helpful. Breakfast was great as well. I would recommend this place to anyone!
reviews.title: Best kept secret

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked Globus through Venere.com. After checking into the hotel, they said I would have gotten a cheaper rate if I booked directly, so heads up on that note.
reviews.title: Needs a good scrubbing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It was an absolute nightmare to find the place. With the help of Nicola at the front desk, he guided us to the hotel. You have to park offsite in a garage and you MUST walk up a flight of steep stairs to get to the lobby level. There is no way around this.
reviews.title: fab florence and fab hotel

likes.disliked: — the lift is a bit scary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in and they were painting the hallways, in the busiest season, mid summer. We got into the first room on the top floor, and it stunk like paint, and the vents were filled with dust and dirt in the bathroom. We asked to change rooms, and we were put in a room on the first floor by the front desk with a view of the boilers for the adjacent buildings. The AC vent was also missing from this room. They said that there was no way bugs or insects could enter the room, and I insisted that they close the hole up, even if it was with paper. After speaking with the manager, they finally obliged. There was no other rooms to move us to, and they would not refund our money, as we booked through a wholesaler. For this trouble, they did deduct 20 euro from the price.
reviews.title: Good base for exploring Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location - about a 5 minute walk to all sites including the train station. The tall gentleman at reception was extremely helpful - especially with food recommendations - we were never disappointed during our 3 night stay. Hotel was recently refurbished and everything was very clean. Breakfast was fantastic - loved all the cold meats and th hot chocolate. Try the deli down the road - you won't be disappointed!! Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Fantastic location and hotel!

likes.disliked: — Nothing! Best 3 star we have ever stayed in!

reviews.title: Hotel Globus
reviews.text: Just returned from a long weekend in Florence and stayed at the Hotel Globus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: 9 in our party in total and we had double, triiple and quadruple rooms, including for 4 children.
reviews.title: Great hotel for value and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the Hotel is on a narrow side street and probably not the best part of town, this is easily outweighed by its proximity to The Duomo (only a few minutes walk) and all the other city sights. It is almost immediately adjacent to the street and food market.
reviews.title: wonderful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, only 5 minutes walk from the rail station so no taxi required - it is better and cheaper to use the train to and from the airport rather than the coach.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a little difficult to find despite the fact that it is close to the train station but the hotel itself is very nice inside and the staff are really helpful and very friendly. I really liked the fact that they had an internet terminal and that you were able pick up some food and sit in the small breakfast area and eat or have a drink if you didn't want to take your food to your room. The rooms were clean and modern and the TV even worked and had lots of channels (unlike most hotels we stayed at). The only thing that I didn't like was the area at night as there were lots of people hanging around in the small streets and I wouldn't recommend coming back to the hotel really late at night. When we were looking for the hotel that first morning I was thinking "What kind of hotel is this?" as there were many people loitering around in the street drinking and stuff but when we got into the hotel I was glad to find that the hotel was nothing like the surrounding area!! I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good Experience in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: i found it quite challenging to locate the hotel after i got off the train station. though very near the station, the hotel is located on a side street that, even after a few days of staying there, i'd still get lost finding it when i walk around florence. the hotel is also very near the market which, to me, adds to the confusion of locating it. because florence is such a walkable city, any hotel is ideal to stay in. including this one. honestly, i expected more from this hotel in terms of aesthetics. check out its website and you'd really expect a kind of boutique hotel. but it is not. the only thing going for it is the staff. very very nice and helpful. there's also free internet access. and the breakfast is adequate. the first time you check in, don't be surprised, but just be amused at how the lift works. you have to put your finger on button of your desired floor UNTIL you reach that floor, or else the lift would stop. i found it amusing. also, be prepared to walk up to the reception because the lift only starts from the second floor reception. overall, it is an adequate hotel. i'd say good value for money.
reviews.title: good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice hotel, conveniently located in the historic center of Florence. We found it very convenient to the train station and the historic sites.
reviews.title: Conveniently located

likes.disliked: — Noise with windows open; temperature with window closed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room wasn't posh, but it was clean and comfortable. Our room faced the street in front of the hotel. When the window was open, noise was a problem. Fortunately, the window had double-paned glass and shutters. When closed they shut out the noise. However, the room would get a little warm overnight.
reviews.title: LOVED the Globus

likes.liked: — Updated furnishings, immaculate room, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was good. The room had satellite TV, with dozens of channels.
reviews.title: Overated!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are what you would expect for the money and the location is an easy walk from the train station - and very easy to find contrary to prev posts. The area immed around the hotel is wonderful during the day, but at night is inhabited by somewhat shady characters depending on which direction you head. Finally, I have to admit that in the time that I was there, I didn't find the staff to be condescending all the time - there were one or two exceptions.
reviews.title: Close to train - dicey area at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We must have stayed in the worst room of the hotel- our view included an old washing mashine and a water heater. The room barely fit our luggage. The bed was comfortable though and the washroom nicely renovated and clean. The big downside is that there is no elevator to get to the lobby so if you have heavy luggage, it’s a chore getting there. The staff were very friendly though and the breakfast nice.
reviews.title: Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel Globus was a great place to stay and I would thoroughlyrecommend it. I was a little unsure about trusting an internet site review but chose this one because it didnt have many negative comments...and we were not disappointed!
reviews.title: 24th -26th May Loved the Hotel, loved the Coffee with breakfast!!

likes.liked: — It was very clean and the surroundings were very pleasant
likes.disliked: — The funny foreign disenfectant smell that they use to clean the bathrooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed in many hotels around Europe and worked in a 2 stars hotel in Paris couple yeras ago. Hotel Globus is not a 3 stars hotel at all. I and my friend booked a economy room trough the website 75 euros per night. This is the smallest room i have ever been. You can hardly move in this room, altough we are not big neither tall (181 cm and 72 kg). Even the 2 stars hotel i used to work in have much larger rooms. I can say that i was mislead by the good reviews in tripadvisor. The bar and breakfast place looked like a fraternity house and smells very bad. I won't stay here ever.
reviews.title: Not worth ti stay in this hotel

likes.disliked: — The size of the room and nauseous smell in the breakfast/bar room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights at the beginning of our stay in Tuscany. The location is a few blocks from the Santa Maria Novella train station, so it is very convenient to take the shuttle bus from the airport to the train station for Euro 4.50 and then walk to the hotel. The hotel is very close to San Lorenzo, but it is on a narrow street with very little car traffic. In fact, the street was so quiet that voices became amplified during the night, and I was awakened a couple of times by the voices of people walking by. Of course, our room fronted the street.
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel, great price

likes.disliked: — The room wasn't the biggest one I've been in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The furnishings are very pleasant and new without being overly trendy, and the bathroom was particularly nice. Hairdryer provided. Comfortable bed. Very good breakfast, complete with meat, cheese, pate, fresh fruit (oranges, kiwis, etc while we were there), several types of bread/pastry, and of course cold cereal.
reviews.title: Excellent, would recommend to anyone
Excellent location for touring Florence
reviews.text: When we returned to stay for one night at the end of our travels, we were informed that our room had no electricity and the electrician hadn't been able to take care of it that day. Globus had already booked us a very nice room in another hotel just a few blocks away. They gave us clear directions, and there was not a bit of fuss. Our stay at Globus had been prepaid, so we were not charged for our stay in the other hotel -- Globus covered the cost. Globus also gave us a nice apology note and a bottle of chianti classico for our troubles. It went absolutely as smoothly as you could hope, in the event of that kind of a problem. The best kind of service imaginable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose to stay at this hotel after seeing it rated so highly on trip advisor and werent disappointed. Its in a very central location, close to station and to the Duomo (although Florence isnt that big so cant be too far away!). The service was great, spoke english and very good at recommending restaurants etc. (try Trattoria ZaZa in market square-very good!). Room was very large although we had a superior one, bath and shower as well as heated towel rack which was useful for drying clothes as it rained most of the time we were there! Breakfast very tasty and served until 10pm. All in all would highly recommend it and wouldnt hestitate to go back.
reviews.title: Awesome Position and great place to base yourself

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In terms of location The Globus is pretty good. It’s a 5 minute walk from the train station which is very handy if you’re transferring from Pisa airport. All the main attractions North of the Arno are all in walking distance in the opposite direction.
reviews.title: Good value Globus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006
reviews.text: Our superior room was clean, in good order and of a reasonable size. But our friends opted for a standard room which looked a bit on the snug side. I can only imagine how small the economy rooms are!
reviews.title: Exellent Hotel! Excellent Location! Excellent Staff! - From Toronto

likes.liked: — Location and price for the clean hotel
likes.disliked: — Nothing to say...everything was as expected and excellent for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was generally furnished quite nicely and offered a good range of amenities (wi-fi, Sky, mini-bar etc) given that it was a fairly small place. However, the stairwells could have done with a lick of paint and 1 or 2 things were starting to look a little tired. The bedspreads in the room for instance.
reviews.title: Amazing Value

likes.disliked: — stairs to the lobby make luggage handling difficult, low prices mean minimal staff (no one to help you with that luggage)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found all the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. We particularly liked the chap that ran the breakfast room during the bulk of our stay. Didn’t catch his name but he was always very cheerful and chatty in the morning – he makes a mean cup of chocolate as well, so the wife tells me!
reviews.title: I was skeptical, but this is a really great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One tip for the morning is to make sure you get yourself down for breakfast by 9.15 or you could find yourself waiting in reception. Breakfast is served in the bar area which is not biggest of rooms.
reviews.title: Really small

description: Centrally located 5 min. walk from Firenze S.M. Novella train station and Duomo, contemporary, intimate boutique hotel offering free WI-FI, free buffet breakfast, free Happy Hour, complimentary coffe and tea in lobby, laundry service (extra), major Credit cards accepted, Garage nearby (extra charge). 23 rooms offer : air conditioning/heating, SKY TV, minibar, safe, hairdrier,WI-FI, superior rooms with laptop.
